definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那里他专心一志地做生意，在几年中就赚到许多钱。

sentences.english: That good for nothing never sends any money to his poor mother.
sentences.chinese: 那个没用的家伙，从不给他可怜的母亲送钱。

sentences.english: Perhaps he earned the money through ill means.
sentences.chinese: 或许他的钱是通过卑劣的手段挣来的。

sentences.english: The cunning thief stole the money out of the man's pocket.
sentences.chinese: 狡滑的小偷从那位男士的口袋里偷了钱。

sentences.english: Oh Fiona found out she had some money in her pocket.
sentences.chinese: 哦，霏欧纳兜里带了着些钱。

sentences.english: "The software company did not charge us too much, " says Feng.
sentences.chinese: “那家软件公司也没跟我们要很多钱，”冯说。

sentences.english: Although it is not expensive, we never seem to have quite enough money.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这是不昂贵的，我们从来没有，似乎已很够了钱。

sentences.english: The second chapter makes contribution in chemical fiber for Qian Baojun science and technology.
sentences.chinese: 第二章为钱宝钧在化学纤维研究方面的贡献。

sentences.english: Everyone has to try to contribute $10 from money that we have earned ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都必须努力从自己挣到的钱里拿出十美元捐献。

sentences.english: They paid a lot of wampum for the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们为那工作付出很多的钱。

sentences.english: The South Korean government spends millions promoting contemporary Korean culture abroad.
sentences.chinese: 韩国政府花了数百万的钱推广当代韩国文化。

sentences.english: Those are only our decoration, coz we never follow the money.
sentences.chinese: 那只是偶们的装饰品，偶们从来不会被钱奴役。

sentences.english: Mrs. Black spent all her money betting on horses.
sentences.chinese: 布莱克夫人把她所有的钱都花在了赌马上。

sentences.english: She married and divorced twice, stripping both husbands of their cash.
sentences.chinese: 她曾经结婚两次，把两任丈夫的钱全部洗劫了。

sentences.english: He placed the money on the table.
No wonder his wife is penniless; he is always playing the horses and losing his money. (CDIP)
sentences.chinese: 难怪他妻子身无分文，他老是赌赛马，把钱都输光了。

definition: high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
